Text: Maryland seafood for the Final Fourpst imagesspacergif imagesspecialggif Congratulations to our very own Maryland Terrapins basketball team for their victory on Sunday to advance to their second straight Final Four scheduled for this coming weekend Were extremely proud of our Terps especially proud since we have Crisfield native Andre Collins on this years team Final Four Special To celebrate Marylands achievements in this years NCAA tournament we are offering the choice of FREE live Maine Lobster l lb FREE pound of sea scallops or FREE pint of shucked Chesapeake Bay oysters with all orders of product totalling or more Simply note which item youd like free in the message section when checking out online at or mention it when calling in your order tollfree to us at EATCRAB Since this offer is made to recipe subscribers only please make sure that you note the free gift If you dont specify it we dont include it Offer expires FREE Crab Place Gift Certificate crabplace Were always striving to improve our level of service to our customers Were currently working with an independent marketing agency to better assess our company strengths and weaknesses Whether youve purchased from us or not please take the time to fill out this onepage survey crabplace and receive a gift certificate from The Crab Place All information is given anonymously Gift certificate will be sent via email within weeks Thanks for helping us serve you better imagesgourmetggif imagesrecipesggif imagescrabmeateggsgifCrab Stuffed Deviled Eggs List of Ingredients cups of Jumbo Lump crab meat cup of mayonnaise Tablespoon of Old Bay seasoning teaspoon of vinegar Tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce cup of celery dash of garlic powder dash of Tabasco sauce large eggs Preparation Instructions Boil the eggs in a pot of water When done drain off water peel and cut eggs on a tray Using a large mixing bowl add vinegar then crab meat and rest of the ingredients in order Sprinkle garlic powder to taste and add a dash of Tabasco sauce Throw in the egg yolks and mix all together Place mix in the center of egg Sprinkle with parsley chill and serve Makes servings This recipe is acredited to Byron Taylor of Crisfield Md and was rd Place Winner of the Crab Cooking Contest Appetizer Divisionin Crisfield Md Crab Pate with Almonds List of Ingredients cup butter cup chopped unblanched almonds small onion chopped ounces cream cheese ounces backfin crab meat tablespoon brandy teaspoon ground mace salt to taste Preparation Instructions Melt the butter over medium heat in a small skillet When it foams add the almonds Turn the heat to low and saute the almonds stirring often until they are golden brown Remove them with a slotted spoon and reserve Cook the onion in the same butter stirring often until it is wilted and just starting to turn gold Remove from pan Reserve the butter Use a processor blender or mortar and pestle to crush the almonds and onions to a smooth paste In a small bowl work the cream cheese until it is soft then work in the almond and onion puree Stir in the crab meat and seasonings adding the reserved butter last Let the pate mellow for minutes or so then taste it and adjust the salt This pate will stay good for or days in the refrigerator Let it come almost to room temperature before serving then serve with crusty French bread Scalloped Oysters List of Ingredients cup butter cup flour teaspoons paprika teaspoon salt teaspoon black pepper teaspoons green pepper chopped teaspoons diced onion teaspoon garlic finely chopped tablespoons lemon juice tablespoon Worcestershire sauce quart oysters juice from oysters cracker crumbs Preparation Instructions Melt butter stir in flour cook minutes or until brown stirring constantly Add paprika and pepper cook for minutes Add salt green pepper onion and garlic cook for minutes Remove from heat and add lemon juice Worcestershire sauce oysters and liquor from oysters Pour into baking dish and sprinkle with cracker crumbs Bake at degrees for minutes You received this mailer because you subscribed to it If however you have received it in error or if you do not wish to receive future mailings product to the site If theres something were missing that you would like to see please let us know BIG SPECIAL Get OFF everything in the store through March Its a great time to stock up on your favorite frozen foods or save big on fresh seafood for your favorite Maryland recipe All items are on sale Simply enter the coupon code of savebig without the quotes when checking out online or mention it when calling in your order tollfree at EATCRAB This offer is made to recipe subcribers only and cannot be combined with any other offer discount or promotion imagesgourmetggif imagesrecipesggif imagesoldbaycakesgifOld Bay Crab Cakes List of Ingredients slices bread crusts removed milk pound special crab meat egg beaten teaspoon salt teaspoon Old Bay Seasoning tablespoon baking powder tablespoon chopped parsley tablespoon Worcestershire sauce tablespoon mayonnaise oil for frying Preparation Instructions Break bread in small pieces and moisten with milk combine with remaining ingredients Shape into patties Fry quickly in or tablespoons hot oil until brown Serves When The Baltimore Spicy Company left the crab cake recipe off of the Old Bay Seafood Seasoning can its switch boards lit up with callers wanting to know why Here it is so its always close at hand CrabStuffed Red Snapper List of Ingredients cup minced onion tablespoons butter pound backfin crab meat cup fresh bread crumbs cup fresh chopped parsley cup heavy cream teaspoon lemon thyme pound red snapper dressed for stuffing salt and pepper cup dry white wine mixed with cup melted butter Preparation Instructions Saute onion in butter until golden Remove from heat and mix in the crab meat bread crumbs parsley heavy cream and lemon thyme Sprinkle cavity of fish lightly with salt and pepper Stuff the fish and skewer edges securely Place fish in a greased baking pan pour winebutter mixture over fish Bake in degree oven uncovered for minutes or just until the flesh is opaque basting frequently with wine sauce Serves to If you feel in the mood to experiment many different kinds of fish can be found at your local seafood market There are fascinating discoveries ahead for people with some imagination and initiative Baked Rockfish with Potatoes List of Ingredients pound rockfish scaled with head tail and innards removed large onion medium sized potatoes thin slices salt pork or tablespoons bacon grease tablespoons flour cups water salt and pepper to taste Preparation Instructions Peel the potatoes and cut into rounds Dice the onion Put the potatoes and onion into a baking dish with the fish Salt and pepper to taste Add the salt pork or bacon grease arranging around the fish Mix tablespoons of flour in cups of water and pour over the fish onion potatoes and salt pork Cover the baking dish and bake at degrees until the rockfish is brown Baking time is about hour You received this mailer because you subscribed to it If however you have received it in error or if you
